definition: to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The movie in DVD is unabridged.
sentences.chinese: DVD版电影是没有经过删节的。

sentences.english: So I told them the truth, albeit somewhat abridged.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我告诉了她们实情，尽管有所删节。

sentences.english: Being an entirely new and unabridged edition.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个全新的，未删节版。

sentences.english: The other, 39 minutes long, was raw footage with no commentary.
sentences.chinese: 另一段39分钟长的视频是没有评论的未删节版原片。

sentences.english: I do have an abridged kids version, though, so maybe I'll crack that open.
sentences.chinese: 我有一套删节过的儿童版，也许我该开封。

sentences.english: The publisher complied, but sent all its unexpurgated copies abroad.
sentences.chinese: 出版商屈从了，但同时也把未删节的副本送到了国外。
他正在对他的书进行删节。

sentences.english: The editor reserves the right to cut manuscripts received.
sentences.chinese: 本编辑保留来稿的删节权。

sentences.english: Is this report the excised version?
sentences.chinese: 这个报告已经是删节版了吧？

sentences.english: It is just fine to put the ellipsis at the end of the article.
sentences.chinese: 删节号用在这篇文章的末尾，恰到好处。

sentences.english: When they were abridged can not be determined.
sentences.chinese: 当他们被删节不能确定。

sentences.english: The director abbreviated the film to let his friends see the shortened version.
sentences.chinese: 导演请他朋友们看的是这部电影他删节后的简缩版。

sentences.english: The censored print editions make money, but the Internet versions are more complete.
sentences.chinese: 删节的图书版本赚钱，但网上的版本更完整。

sentences.english: He truncated a news item to fit the available space.
sentences.chinese: 他删节一则新闻以适合可用的版面。

sentences.english: Note that this is a very truncated quick-start guide.
sentences.chinese: 请注意这是一个删节版的快速指引。

sentences.english: It gives the narrative in a form which is both much abridged and plainly secondary.
sentences.chinese: 它使叙事的形式，这既是许多删节和显然是次要的。

definition: to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to cut (from a movie etc)/to censor
excerpt/selection (from a book)/to select/to choose an extract
